category.name: Aptitude
category.description: Develop mathematical reasoning and problem-solving skills for competitive exams and interviews.

sub_categories.name: Algebra
sub_categories.description: Master algebraic concepts, equations, and mathematical problem-solving techniques.

exercises.title: Systems of Equations
exercises.description: Solve systems of linear equations using various methods.

tasks.title: Gaussian Elimination
tasks.question:
Implement Gaussian elimination to solve a system of linear equations.

Your function should:

  • Accept a coefficient matrix and constant vector
  • Perform row operations to get row-echelon form
  • Use back substitution to find solutions
  • Handle cases with no solution or infinite solutions
  • Return the solution vector
tasks.hint: Use row operations to create zeros below pivots, then back substitute

tasks.title: System Solution Types
tasks.question:
How many solutions does a system of 3 equations with 3 variables have if the determinant is zero?

Consider: Determinant indicates whether the system has a unique solution
tasks.hint: Think about what a zero determinant means for the coefficient matrix
options: No solution or infinite solutions - depends on consistency

tasks.title: Matrix Operations
tasks.question:
Create functions for basic matrix operations.

Your functions should:

  • Add and subtract matrices
  • Multiply matrices
  • Calculate matrix determinant
  • Find matrix inverse
  • Handle matrix validation
tasks.hint: Use nested loops for operations, cofactor expansion for determinant, and adjoint for inverse

exercises.title: Polynomial Functions
exercises.description: Work with polynomial functions and their properties.

tasks.title: Polynomial Evaluation
tasks.question:
Implement polynomial evaluation using Horner's method.

Your function should:

  • Accept coefficients and a value x
  • Use Horner's method for efficient evaluation
  • Handle polynomials of any degree
  • Return the polynomial value
  • Include error handling
tasks.hint: Use Horner's rule: a₀ + a₁x + a₂x² + ... = a₀ + x(a₁ + x(a₂ + ...))

tasks.title: Polynomial Degree
tasks.question:
What is the degree of the polynomial 3x⁴ - 2x² + 5x - 1?

Consider: Degree is the highest power of x with non-zero coefficient
tasks.hint: Look for the term with the highest exponent

tasks.title: Polynomial Division
tasks.question:
Implement polynomial long division.

Your function should:

  • Divide one polynomial by another
  • Return quotient and remainder
  • Handle cases where divisor degree > dividend degree
  • Use synthetic division for efficiency
  • Validate input polynomials
tasks.hint: Use polynomial long division algorithm, subtract multiples of divisor
